title: The Feminine Mystique by Betty Friedan - argued

content.question: In The Feminine Mystique, Betty Friedan argued that women

choices.label: who spent their lives as mothers and homemakers were generally satisfied with their lives
needed counseling if they were dissatisfied with their domestic lives
should battle for ratification of the Equal Rights Amendment
experienced a discrepancy between the reality and the public image of their lives
have special talents and abilities different from those of men

content.answer: experienced a discrepancy between the reality and the public image of their lives

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
